byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The leader of the Nusra Front said in a television interview that Al Qaeda had ordered it to keep its focus on toppling President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.print_headline: Al Qaeda in Syria Denies Planning Attacks Abroad
headline.main: Al Qaeda’s Branch in Syria Denies Planning Attacks Abroad

snippet: The leader of the Nusra Front said in a television interview that Al Qaeda had ordered it to keep its focus on toppling President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, leader of Nursa Front, Al Qaeda's Syrian affiliate, denies claims that goup has been planning foreign attacks, and says goal remains the toppling of Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; remarks, in televised interview with Al Jazeera, follow Western speculation that Nursa Front is preparing to split from Al Qaeda and possibly begin receiving foreign military aid.
